title: Active Learning Strategies for Building Energy Prediction Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners are mid-level domain experts (medical/legal/technical backgrounds) who have adapted to online learning environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can identify data bias issues and generate high-information training data using active learning techniques.
Learners can apply block design strategies that account for weather variability when developing building energy prediction models.
Learners can implement methodologies to evaluate the effectiveness of active learning strategies in virtual/physical building testbeds.
Learners can establish data collection strategies that improve model accuracy and scalability within various constraints (time/budget).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
